item.name: Static Data / NBC
item.description: This folder's routes provide static data such as geography (countries, destinations, regions, or airports) and Non-Bookable Content (NBC). It is recommended to store this data locally on the integrator's side to reduce latency and minimize the number of API requests.

request.description:
This method provides a list of nationalities that are useful for hotel searches, as prices may vary depending on the passenger's nationality and country of residence.

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

This method returns the complete geography hierarchy, structured into countries, regions, and cities.

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

This method returns a list of all airports, including their codes, countries, and continents, which may be used to perform availability requests based on an airport code, for various services, like hotels, packages, and so on.

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

query.description: The ISO country code.
The name of the region.
The name of the city.
First element from an array of hotel IDs.
unsigned integer The offset for pagination.
unsigned integer The limit for pagination.
Describes the volume of returned information. Possible values: minimal, basic, standard, full.

request.description:
This method provides detailed information about hotels, including the hotel's name, category, geo-location, description, and other relevant details that can enhance a content-rich search results page. The data returned by this API should be used to consolidate initial search results into a single hotel profile. However, on the final booking page, the tour operator's information should be displayed.

The query for this endpoint can be based on country (using the 2-letter ISO code), region, city, or an array of hotel IDs (at least one of these parameters must be set). The response is limited to 2500 hotels per request.

EG","phone":"","fax":"","email":"","url":"","geoCodes":"{\"lat\":\"25.2167\",\"long\":\"34.8056\"}","chains":"","wlan":"YES","wifi":"NO","restaurant":"YES","parking":"YES","aircon":"YES","gym":"YES","pool":"YES","wheelchair":"NO","year_construction":"-1","year_renovation":"-1","num_floors_main":"-1","num_rooms_total":"-1","num_suites":"-1","has_entertainment":"NO","hoteltype_adultsonly":"NO","hoteltype_beachhotel":"NO","hoteltype_business":"NO","hoteltype_historic":"NO","hoteltype_cityhotel":"NO","description_en":"Location: This hotel warmly welcomes guests in Marsa Alam. Facilities: The friendly staff at the reception desk in the lobby are happy to answer any questions. A playroom, a laundry service, a theatre hall and a hotel doctor are available. Wireless internet access allows guests to surf the internet and catch up on email. There are also a number of shops that make for great strolling and browsing. Children can enjoy the playground. Guests arriving by car can park their vehicles in the car park. Rooms: Rooms feature a living room, a kitchen and a bathroom. Air conditioning ensures comfortable temperatures. Guests have a sea view from the balcony or terrace, which are standard features of some rooms. Separate bedrooms can be booked. Children's beds can be requested for younger guests. A safe and, for a fee, a minibar are also available. Guests will also find a tea/coffee station included among the standard features. A telephone, a flatscreen television with satellite channels and WiFi (for a fee) ensure optimal comfort. Bathrooms are equipped with a shower and a hairdryer. Family rooms are available for parents with children. Sports/Entertainment: The outdoor pool complex includes a children's swimming area and is ideal for working out or just relaxing. Fun on the waterslide and a relaxing soak in the hot tub (no extra charge) offer the perfect way to unwind. Guests can relax and enjoy the sun loungers and parasols provided. For guests who wish to keep active, tennis, bocce and beach volleyball are available. Alternatively, guests can try out aquafit or, for a fee, diving. The hotel offers numerous indoor sports, including a gym, billiards and aerobics or, for a fee, table tennis. There is a wellness area with a sauna, a beauty salon and massage treatments and, for an additional fee, a spa, a steam bath and a hammam. Leisure facilities include a kids' club, a kids' disco and live music.  Meals: Various dining options are available, including a buffet restaurant, a café and a bar. All-inclusive is offered as a catering option. Breakfast, lunch and dinner are available. The hotel also offers snacks. The hotel offers a selection of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages. Payment: The following credit cards are accepted: VISA and MasterCard. request.description:
This endpoint retrieves a list of hotel categories, ranging from "Uncategorized" to "6 Stars"

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

This endpoint returns a list of hotel meal plans available for accommodations.

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

item.name: Hotel API
item.description: The Hotel Booking API facilitates real-time searching and booking of hotel rooms.

request.description: This method combines the functionality of `search` and `results`, performing a synchronous hotel search. Instead of initiating a search session and polling for results separately, this method returns hotel results in a single API call. The search process is executed as follows: 1. A search request is made with the required parameters. 2. The system waits for the search process to complete. 3. The final hotel availability results are returned in the response. This method follows the same request parameters as `search`, ensuring compatibility. Important: When using this method, the separate `search` and `results` methods should not be used ❗ The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

request.description: Initiates a search for available hotels using the provided parameters and returns a unique session identifier called `search_session` and a `search code`. This information will be included in the POST data for the remainder of the booking process. The search results will be delivered through a polling process, where all results will be returned along with the search progress. This route also returns a node called `auditData`, which includes a cookie name and value. For all subsequent requests, the header must include the cookie returned from the initial search; otherwise, you may receive empty responses. Important: When this method is used, `searchSync` method should not be integrated ❗ The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

response.body: {"status":false,"error":{"search_type":["The search type field is required."],"checkin":["The checkin field is required."],"checkout":["The checkout field is required."],"rooms":["The rooms field is required."],"currency":["The currency field is required."],"nationality":["Nationality must be a valid GIATA code."],"residence":["Residence must be a valid GIATA code."]},"responseToken": "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"}
response.name: Unprocessable Content

request.description: This method retrieves the search results for a previously initiated hotel search. It can be called repeatedly until the progress reaches 100%, with a 2-second delay between consecutive calls. It requires the `search_session` and `search_code` obtained from the `search` method to identify and retrieve the corresponding results. Important: The `refundable` property in each object within the groups array indicates whether an option is eligible for a refund. This property can have a value of `"0" (non-refundable)` or `"1" (refundable)`. Options marked with `refundable: "1"` are considered refundable based on information provided by our partners. However, cancellation and refund policies may vary and are subject to change without notice. We recommend reviewing the specific cancellation terms for each option before finalizing a reservation. We do not assume responsibility for any discrepancies regarding the refundability status of options. Important: When this method is used, `searchSync` method should not be integrated ❗ The request must include the `SESSIONID` header, obtained from the `cookieValue` in the `search` method's response. The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

request.description:
This request is used to verify availability and pricing, along with other solution details, and should be performed after the search and before confirming the booking.

The `id` and `code` properties are used to identify a single solution and are the same as those in the `results` response from the `groups` array.

The request must include the `SESSIONID` header, obtained from the `cookieValue` in the `search` method's response.

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

request.description:
This method retrieves detailed information about a specific hotel.

It should be used alongside the valuation method to obtain the tour operator's hotel details, as the initial search results are grouped under a unique hotel profile that may not fully reflect the evaluated offer.

The request must include the `SESSIONID` header, obtained from the `cookieValue` in the `search` method's response.

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

request.description:
This request is the final step to complete a room booking.

The request must include the `SESSIONID` header, obtained from the `cookieValue` in the `search` method's response.

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

request.description:
This request is used to cancel a booking.

If the cancellation is made within the cancellation policy period, a penalty may be charged.

If the cancellation is made outside the policy period, no charge will be applied.

The `code` property must match the reference received in the booking response.

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

item.name: Package API
item.description: The Package Booking API enables searching and booking complete travel packages.

query.description: The query must be either `all` or one or more of: `sk, tour, cruise, circuit ..` All will return all available packages, while filtering by circuit, for instance, will return only the departures for the circuit packages. .

request.description:
Retrieves departures for the available travel packages. Every departure consists in a set of departure dates with price per person, for a departure airport / arival airport pair.

For the same departure airport / arival airport pair, there could be multiple length of stay.

The method might help in populating search forms or adding the pricing in a calendar like view.

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

query.description: Search type must be one of the following values:
The number of nights of the offer `e.g. "4,5,6,7,8,9"` .
Brand must be provided as a comma-separated list of unsigned integers, defining the desired brands ID `e.g. "1,2,3"` .
Room 1 - for adults only, use `X`. For adults with kids, use `X-Y,Y,Y,Y` where `X` is the number of adults (1-4) and `Y` are the ages of kids (0-18).
Subtype must be a comma-separated list of subtypes: `sky,cruise,circuit,tour`.
Status must be one of the following values:
Search method must be one of the following values:
Hotel name `e.g. Hilton` .
Hotel code `e.g. 12345` .
Hotel giata code `e.g. 54321` .
Stars represent the hotel rating and must be provided as a comma-separated list of unsigned integers `(e.g. 2,3,4,5,...)`.
Departure Airport must be provided as a comma-separated list of IATA airport codes `(e.g. PRG,LAX,CDG,...)`.
Departure Country must be provided as a comma-separated list of ISO country codes `(e.g. FR,US,SI,...)`.
Departure Region Ids must be provided as a comma-separated list of unsigned integers `(e.g. 123)`.
Departure City Ids must be provided as a comma-separated list of unsigned integers `(e.g. 123)`.
Arrival Country must be provided as a comma-separated list of ISO country codes `(e.g. FR,US,SI,...)`.
Arrival Airport must be provided as a comma-separated list of IATA airport codes `(e.g. PRG,LAX,CDG,...)`.
Arrival Region Ids must be provided as a comma-separated list of unsigned integers `(e.g. 123)`.
Arrival City Ids must be provided as a comma-separated list of unsigned integers `(e.g. 123)`.
Direct flight must be `true` or `false` .
Offer Interval START From - must match the format `Y-m-d`
Offer Interval START To - must match the format `Y-m-d`
Offer Interval END From - must match the format `Y-m-d`
Offer Interval END To - must match the format `Y-m-d`
Accommodation Interval START From - must match the format `Y-m-d`
Accommodation Interval START To - must match the format `Y-m-d`
Accommodation Interval END From - must match the format `Y-m-d`
Accommodation Interval END To - must match the format `Y-m-d`
Transport Interval START From - must match the format `Y-m-d`
Transport Interval START To - must match the format `Y-m-d`
Transport Interval END From - must match the format `Y-m-d`
Transport Interval END To - must match the format `Y-m-d`
Min price (offer) `e.g. 1000` .
Max price (offer) `e.g. 5000` .
Min price (per pax) `e.g. 500` .
Max price (per pax) `e.g. 2500` .
The number of nights of the accommodation `e.g. 7` .
Supplier Code must be provided as a comma-separated list of unsigned integers `e.g. 10,20` .
Meals must be provided as a comma-separated list of meal plans `RO, BB, HB, FB, AI, OTH`.
Has promo must be `true` or `false` .
Room 2 - for adults only, use `X`. For adults with kids, use `X-Y,Y,Y,Y` where `X` is the number of adults (1-4) and `Y` are the ages of kids (0-18).
Start - pagination parameter `e.g 0` .
Limit - pagination parameter `e.g 3000` .

request.description:
This method searches for travel packages based on specified criteria.

The search results include available offers that match the search criteria.

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

request.description:
This method retrieves a single offer based on the `serviceId`, which is obtained from the response of the `search` method.

It is used to get the complete details of the respective offer.

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

response.name: Unprocessable content

request.description:
This method triggers a double-check mechanism, reconfirming the price and availability for the selected offer

Additionally, it returns the cancellation policies for the package, under the form of an array of policies, where the price coming in the `charge` property is represented in the same currency like the initial offer price.

It can optionally be continued with an Extra Services method call to retrieve the list of optional services which could be booked together with the package (like parking, insurance, ski-pass, etc).

In case the solution is not available anymore, the method will return a message stating that the solution couldn't have been matched.

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

response.name:
Success
The `newSolution` property represents the new `serviceId` useful for the Extra Services and Book methods. It stays for the double-checked solution ID and the booking will be commited based on this ID

request.description:
This method provides detailed information about the hotel.

It should be used in conjunction with the Verify method to retrieve the tour operator's specific hotel details, since the initial search results are grouped under a unique hotel profile that may have slight variations from the tour operator's information.

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

response.body:
{"status":true,"message":"ok","hotel":{"name":"Iris Boutique Hotel","adress":"Kamari 847 00 Kamari, Santorini","classification":"3","phone":"30-22860-31390","latitude":"36.37427","longitude":"25.48152","description":"

HeadLine: Near Kamari Beach

Location: When you stay at Iris Boutique Hotel in Santorini, you'll be near the beach, a 1-minute drive from Kamari Beach and 6 minutes from Ancient Thira. This hotel is 6.1 mi (9.8 km) from Athinios Port and 8 mi (13 km) from Perissa Beach.

Rooms: Make yourself at home in one of the 44 air-conditioned rooms featuring refrigerators and flat-screen televisions. Complimentary wireless internet access keeps you connected, and digital programming is available for your entertainment. Private bathrooms with showers feature complimentary toiletries and hair dryers. Conveniences include safes, housekeeping is provided daily, and cribs/infant beds (complimentary) can be requested.

Dining: Grab a bite from the snack bar/deli serving guests of Iris Boutique Hotel. Unwind at the end of the day with a drink at the bar/lounge or the poolside bar. A complimentary buffet breakfast is served daily from 8 AM to 10:30 AM.

Renovations: The property is closed between October 23 and April 30.

CheckIn Instructions:

  • Extra-person charges may apply and vary depending on property policy
  • Government-issued photo identification and a credit card, debit card, or cash deposit may be required at check-in for incidental charges
  • Special requests are subject to availability upon check-in and may incur additional charges; special requests cannot be guaranteed
  • This property accepts major credit cards; cash is not accepted

Special Instructions: This property doesn’t offer after-hours check-in. Front desk staff will greet guests on arrival.

query.description: Represents a unique identifier generated during the `booking process`. It identifies the specific reservation that is to be canceled.

request.description:
This method cancels an existing reservation using the provided reference and returns the status and a message. If the status in the result is true, it means the booking was successfully canceled.

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

query.description: Represents a unique identifier generated during the `booking process` and used to retrieve specific details of the reservation.

request.description:
Returns information about an existing reservation.

It includes details about the reservation such as travel dates, passenger information, room details, prices, cancellation policies and additional services.

If the response status is cancelled_after_cxl, we have cancellationCharge, which shows the cost of canceling the reservation after the deadline.

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

request.description: Will be released soon. 🚧 The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

This method processes hotel-related actions via XML requests. The TBM XML request allows performing various actions, including checking availability, making bookings, canceling reservations, issuing vouchers, and displaying booking details. Structure of the TbmXmlRequest: The root element of the XML request is , which contains various attributes: - `ver`: The version of the request. - `usr`: The username of the operator making the request. - `typ`: The type of user (e.g., admin). - `enc`: The encoding type (e.g., text). - `rip`, `sid`, `svr`, `lng`: Additional parameters related to the request (e.g., language, server). ``: The primary node under which all operations are defined. This node holds all the important actions that need to be performed. It includes the following attributes: - `typ`: Type of admin request:through,soft. - `prd`: Defines whether the action is refundable or not, valid values are "yes" or "no". - `sub`: Optional subtype for the request. - `opt`: Optional additional options for the request. - `rem`: Optional note for analysis purposes, e.g., "user id 1234". The `` node contains one element, with attributes such as: - `act`: The action type (e.g., OA, BA, O, S, F, D). - `knd`, `toc`, `psn`, `bst`: Additional parameters for the specific operation. - `mst`: Any additional settings, like membership status. Available actions: - `OA` (Availability Check - Refundable) → Checks if a reservation can be made with a refundable option. - `BA` (Availability Check - Non-refundable) → Checks if a reservation can be made, without considering the refundable option. - `O` (Book Confirmed) → Creates a confirmed reservation. - `B` (Book OK2Buy) → Creates a reservation that is ready for purchase (OK2Buy). - `S` (Cancel) → Cancels an existing reservation. - `F` (Issue Voucher) → Issues a voucher for a confirmed reservation. - `D` (Display Booking) → Retrieves booking details. - `I` (Info) → Tests if the system is alive. The `` element may also include following elements: - ``: A list of services associated with the booking. It contains `` nodes that specify service details. - ``: Information about the customer making the booking (e.g., name, address, phone number). - ``: A list of travellers involved in the booking, with details such as name, age, nationality, and other personal information. - ``: Content of the debt collection mask. - ``: Prices from cache, for statistical purposes and possible corrections. - ``: Contents of the partial mask. - ``: Details of Strong Customer Authentication. The request is structured in XML format and must be valid to be processed successfully. The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

item.name: Back Office API
item.description: Provides tools for managing bookings and invoices.

request.description:
This request is used to rebook a room.

The request must include the `SESSIONID` header, obtained from the `cookieValue` in the `search` method's response.

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

request.description:
This method retrieves a list of bookings within a specified date range, based on specific booking IDs, or by their last update date.

You can use either a date range (`from` - `to`), an update date range (`from_updated` - `to_updated`), or an array of booking IDs to filter the results.

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

request.description:
This method retrieves a list of invoices based on various criteria provided in the request body.

### Response: Possible values for next fields:

- serviceType, reservationService: `hotel`, `transfer`, `flight`, `rentcar`, `activity`, `entryfee`, `guide`, `bus`, `restaurant`, `nova`, `charter`, `sport_events`, `groups`, `experience`, `insurance`, `din_package`, `visaandinsurance`, `cruise`, `bus_charter`, `offline_product`
- reservationStatus: `pending`, `pending_quote`, `confirmed`, `oktobuy`, `waiting_cancellation`, `waiting_cancellation_after_cxl`, `cancelled`, `rejected`, `errordetails`, `temporary`, `cancelled_after_cxl`
- furnizorId > 0: means the reservation is considered **offline**

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.

request.description:
This method retrieves a list of providers available to the agency.

The optional `API-SOURCE` header can be either `B2B` (default) or `B2C`, specifying the system source of the data.
